timeline.bodyText:
This call is actually not that safe it could be another refreshJob by now, could we just leave it set? Instead of null-ing a potential different job.
I see that we do this very often and it has not much practical benefit imho.
CC: @openhab/add-ons-maintainers
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText:
The only way it would be a different job is if initialize() was called concurrently with dispose(). And if that was the case then you would also need to take precautions to not overwrite an existing job without cancelling the old one.
Now if the framework never calls initialize or dispose concurrently then I think nulling the fields in dispose would be needless but harmless to do.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: So as I understand it is a common practice all over bindings, I leave it as it is
replies.author: clinique
